document_data.name: Piminasi
document_data.title: The Padhrasattva of Abundance
document_data.mainbody: '''Piminasi''' was the [[Padhrasattva]] of Abundance within the [[Padhran religion]].
document_data.Description: Statues depicted Piminasi as an immensely fat person with a cherubic expression.
document_data.Holy Sites: In the [[Potala]] in [[Saikhoi]], [[Ra-Khati]], there was a small room containing a massive statue of Piminasi, staring out over a balcony at the eastern mountains. Once a month, when the light of the sun and the moon both fell upon the statue's eyes (that is, when the full moon hung over the eastern horizon at sunrise), a secret door opened in the statue's belly, leading to the Secret Vault of the Morning Moon, where treasures were kept.
